title: Classic Chocolate Chip Cookies
description: Soft, chewy chocolate chip cookies with crispy edges and gooey centers. This timeless recipe uses brown butter for extra depth of flavor and creates the perfect cookie every time.
chefNotes: For extra chewy cookies, chill the dough for 30 minutes before baking. The brown butter adds a nutty depth that makes these cookies irresistible!

steps.instruction: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Line baking sheets with parchment paper.
In a medium bowl, whisk together flour, baking soda, and salt. Set aside.
In a large bowl, cream together softened butter, granulated sugar, and brown sugar until light and fluffy, about 3-4 minutes.
Beat in eggs one at a time, then add vanilla extract. Mix until well combined.
Gradually fold in the flour mixture until just combined. Do not overmix.
Fold in chocolate chips until evenly distributed throughout the dough.
Drop rounded tablespoons of dough onto prepared baking sheets, spacing them 2 inches apart.
Bake for 10-12 minutes, or until edges are golden brown but centers still look slightly underdone.
Cool on baking sheet for 5 minutes before transferring to a wire rack. Cookies will continue to firm up as they cool.
